title: Permanent Suspension
body: So I've been banned and I can admit I have said a lot of toxic things over and over again but for my account to be permanently banned is ridiculous. Permanently ban my in-game chat so I cant speak to anyone but not my account. Especially since I have put a lot of hours and money into this game. Everyone is different and many people can't keep their cool but unfortunately Riot doesn't understand that.

replies.body:
Well maybe you need to understand that a community of complete strangers who don't even fucking know you, don't like your attitude enough to take time out of their day to report you for being an ass (when a decent chunk of the community actually think reports do nothing), these are people who don't need to hear you, and yet you are being toxic again and again, and after several bans, you have been told that enough people are sick of your shit, that Riot themselves don't want you on their game.

A tip for if you ever make a new account, unbind your chat key, cause if you don't you will get banned again, because no one want's to hear you, play the game, and don't be a toxic turd, and you can actually stay playing the game.

As for your account, your not entitled to it anymore, because you are that 2 year old that gets their toys taken off them because they are being a little shit.

>I have put a lot of hours and money into this game

do you have absolutely any idea how many permabanned people say this exact line in every one of their pleas for their account back? its interesting really isnt it. are they all trying to be submissive and manipulative even after all their warnings only just when they realise its too late. what would happen if you got your account back instantly the day after it said you were permabanned, after just pleading with them with these same submissive/manipulative tactics of persuasion, i wonder how many people would truly be "reformed" forever. judging by this thread and countless other previous ones, looks like riot made the right decision though :P

I just want everyone to know that I take full responsibility for my stupid actions. I take everything back. If I could speak to those I have hurt, I would tell them that I love them and that I'm sorry for the trouble I have cost. I would even mystery gift them to emphasize on my apology. I also completely understand the reasoning for my ban but, rather than leaving this community as a toxic idiot I am, I would like to stay apart of this amazing community and spread positivity. The thing is since I have gone through all those chat restrictions that were suppose to make me less toxic, I never really read it and just clicked 'I Understand'. I treated it just like accepting terms and conditions. No one reads those but we still click I accept. But now that I'm banned, I am able to read all those nasty things I said and really understand the damage I caused. All I ask is forgiveness.

You are free to create a new account, but long story short you won't be unbanned. Bans will only be lifted if they have been made in error. 14 day was your final warning and you chose to ignore it.

If you want to be better and continue to be a part of the community then create a new account, and prove it to the people who's days you ruined. Prove that you can be better, if only for yourself.

Forgiveness tends to require a desire for reformation/reparation, so demonstrate that. You won't get your account back, but if you become a positive player not only will you get rewards you were previously unable to, you also won't have to worry about facing bans again.
Don't even bother anymore the amount of people who post this shit daily get 0 attention Riot doesn't care about you

So you willingly broke the rules consistently enough to get hit with a perma-ban and think you have *any* right to the account?

That's a bigger joke than colonel j thinking they're a sheriff...

I would like to take his opportunity to point out that the account was never yours, it was *always* Riot's. You agreed that you have no interest in taking ownership of the account (or the "assets" of the account) and that all of the "assets" (skins, champs etc.) have no monetary value. You also agreed to uphold a certain standard of behaviour in-game. Fact is, you don't have a leg to stand on here.

You broke the rules you agreed to repeatedly and consistently, therefore Riot did their job and removed you from the game. It's really that simple.

This was all after one game. So I'm a uni student who wakes up at 5:00am and finishes at 6:00pm. I come home to play a game of ranked. What do I get, a person who feeds and goes afk. Of course having a rough day I'm going to be toxic and since the afk had a premade, he got the team to hate on me. Look at my match history if you don't believe me!

Nobody cares, even if that is what happened, you were still an ass before that.

If you really want to play, make a new account, and as i said, unbind the chat key, so no one has to listen to you.

I don't get why they ban accounts and not the in game chat. Of course I could make another account and be an ass which I won't but I'd like to keep this account and I'll be willing to pay/receive some sort of restriction whether that be skins being lost or champs or in game chat being blocked which would remove toxicity. If a person can never talk in game they cannot flame. So instead of banning accounts, ban the in game chat. I'd like to speak to someone who works at riot in a peaceful manner about this. Of course I'm at fault but I will swear an oath that this will never happen again and am willing to pay the price!
